articles.title: Bayesian Computational Approaches
articles.contents:
Contents
Maximize posterior distribution

Maximize posterior distribution
Let us define \(p(\boldsymbol{\theta}|\boldsymbol{Y})\) be posterior distribution, and
\[
\widehat{\boldsymbol{\theta}}_{MAP} = \arg\max_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\ln p(\boldsymbol{\theta}|\boldsymbol{Y}) = \arg\max_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\ln f(\boldsymbol{Y}|\boldsymbol{\theta}) + \ln \pi(\boldsymbol{\theta})
\] is the maximizer of \(p(\boldsymbol{\theta}|\boldsymbol{Y})\).
MAP estimator can be obtained by function optim in R. Its illustration in R will be pored over latter.

articles.title: Bayesian Statistics
articles.description:
"Begin with an estimate of the probability that any claim, belief, hypothesis is true, then look at any new data and update the probability given the new data."

-Steven Novella-
